data.enText: plainer
plainest

data.chText: 清楚的；明显的；浅白的
data.enText: easy to see or understand

data.chText: 他明确表示要我们离开。
data.enText: He made it plain that we should leave.

data.chText: 她满脸不耐烦。
data.enText: She made her annoyance plain.

data.chText: 事实显而易见。
data.enText: The facts were plain to see .

data.chText: 这是一个不折不扣的冒牌货。
data.enText: It was a rip-off, plain and simple .

data.chText: 坦诚的；直率的；直接的
data.enText: not trying to trick anyone; honest and direct

data.chText: 事实很明显，没有人真正了解。
data.enText: The plain fact is that nobody really knows.

data.chText: 说话直率出了名的一个政治人物
data.enText: a politician with a reputation for plain speaking

data.chText: 不尚修饰的；朴素的；简单的
data.enText: not decorated or complicated; simple

data.chText: 朴素淡雅的连衣裙
data.enText: a plain but elegant dress

data.chText: 清淡的食物
data.enText: plain food

data.chText: 教堂内部朴素无华。
data.enText: The interior of the church was plain and simple.

data.chText: 原味酸奶
data.enText: plain yogurt (= without sugar or fruit)

data.chText: 素的；无花纹的；单色的
data.enText: without marks or a pattern on it

data.chText: 单色或印花的罩布
data.enText: covers in plain or printed cotton

data.chText: 用无格白纸书写。
data.enText: Write on plain paper (= without lines) .

data.chText: 极普通的；平庸的；平凡的
data.enText: used to emphasize that sth is very ordinary, not special in any way

data.chText: 这项工作不需要任何特殊技能，只要有普通常识就够了。
data.enText: You don't need any special skills for this job, just plain common sense.

data.chText: 相貌平平的；无姿色的
data.enText: not beautiful or attractive

data.chText: （编织）平针的，平纹的
data.enText: describing a simple stitch used in knitting
be plain sailing
be clear sailing

data.chText: 顺利；一帆风顺
data.enText: to be simple and free from trouble
in plain English

data.chText: 用平白的言语（或文字）
data.enText: simply and clearly expressed, without using technical language
(as) plain as a pikestaff
(as) plain as day
(as) plain as the nose on your face

data.chText: 一清二楚；一目了然；显而易见
data.enText: very obvious
plains

data.chText: 平原
data.enText: a large area of flat land

data.chText: 萨索斯岛平坦的滨海平原
data.enText: the flat coastal plain of Thassos

data.chText: 北美洲大平原
data.enText: the Great Plains

data.chText: （用于强调）简直，绝对地
data.enText: used to emphasize how bad, stupid, etc. sth is

data.chText: 简直愚蠢至极；绝对错误
data.enText: plain stupid/wrong

data.text: clear ♦ obvious ♦ apparent ♦ evident ♦ plain ♦ crystal clear

data.chText: 以上各词均形容事物显而易见、明白易懂、清楚、明确。
data.enText: These words all describe sth that is easy to see or understand and leaves no doubts or confusion.
clear

data.chText: 指显而易见的、明白易懂的、清楚的、明确的：
data.enText: easy to see or understand and leaving no doubts

data.chText: 我十分清楚她在撒谎。
data.enText: It was quite clear to me that she was lying.
obvious

data.chText: 指明显的、显然的、易理解的：
data.enText: easy to see or understand

data.chText: 根据他所说的，显然是出问题了。
data.enText: It's obvious from what he said that something is wrong.
apparent

data.chText: 指显而易见、明白易懂、显然：
data.enText: [not usually before noun] ( rather formal ) easy to see or understand

data.chText: 从面容上一眼就可以看出她确实心绪烦乱。
data.enText: It was apparent from her face that she was really upset.
evident

data.chText: 指清楚的、明白的、显然的：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) easy to see or understand

data.chText: 管弦乐队演奏得兴致勃勃。
data.enText: The orchestra played with evident enjoyment.
plain

data.chText: 指清楚的、明显的、浅白的：
data.enText: easy to see or understand

data.chText: 他明确表示要我们离开。
data.enText: He made it very plain that he wanted us to leave.

data.chText: 词语辨析
以上各词意思几乎相同，只是在语体风格和句型使用上稍有区别。make sth clear/plain表示刻意为使别人明白；make sth obvious通常并非刻意：
data.enText: These words all have almost exactly the same meaning. There are slight differences in register and patterns of use. If you make sth clear/plain , you do so deliberately because you want people to understand sth; if you make sth obvious , you usually do it without meaning to.
I hope I make myself obvious.
Try not to make it so clear/plain.

data.chText: 在clear majority（明显多数）、for obvious reasons（因为显而易见的原因）、for no apparent reason（没有明显的原因）和plain to see（显而易见）中，表示“明显”的词不能替换。可以用clear/obvious/plain case of sth（某事的明显例子），但不能用
data.enText: In the expressions clear majority , for obvious reasons , for no apparent reason and plain to see , none of the other words can be used instead. You can have a(n) clear/obvious/plain case of sth but not an
evident case of sth

data.chText: apparent和evident均相当正式，任何时候都可用obvious代替。obvious和evident均可用于表示情感的名词前，意为这种情感显而易见：
data.enText: Apparent and evident are both rather formal. They can always be replaced by obvious . Obvious and evident can both be used before a noun for an emotion, meaning that the emotion is easy to see with your eyes.

data.chText: 她显然很不情愿地把信大声读出。
data.enText: She read the letter out with obvious/evident reluctance.
which word?
crystal clear

data.chText: 指显而易见的、浅显易懂的：
data.enText: very easy to see or understand, leaving no doubt or confusion at all

data.chText: 我想把我的意思解释得清清楚楚。
data.enText: I want to make my meaning crystal clear.
clear/obvious/apparent/evident/plain/crystal clear to sb/sth
clear/obvious/apparent/evident/plain/crystal clear that/what/who/how/where/why…
to be/look/seem/become/make sth clear/obvious/apparent/evident/plain/crystal clear
perfectly/quite/very clear/obvious/apparent/evident/plain
fairly/pretty clear/obvious/apparent/evident/plain
not at all clear/obvious/apparent/evident/plain

data.text: plain ♦ simple ♦ stark ♦ bare ♦ unequivocal ♦ bald

data.chText: 以上各词常形容令人不快的陈述清楚明白、直截了当、简单明了。
data.enText: These words all describe statements, often about sth unpleasant, that are very clear, not trying to hide anything, and not using more words than necessary.
plain

data.chText: 用于他人可能不乐意听的事实或指直率、直接以致他人不喜欢：
data.enText: used for talking about a fact that other people may not like to hear; honest and direct in a way that other people may not like

data.chText: 事实很明显，没有人真正了解。
data.enText: The plain fact is that nobody really knows.
simple

data.chText: 用于他人可能不乐意听的事实或指事物简单明了：
data.enText: [only before noun] used for talking about a fact that other people may not like to hear; very obvious and not complicated by anything else

data.chText: 事实很简单，我们就是付不起。
data.enText: The simple truth is that we just can't afford it.

data.chText: 用plain还是simple？
用以强调他人可能不乐意听的事实时，plain通常用于the plain fact/truth is that ...短语中。simple也可用这种表达方式，但是还可用于更宽泛的句型结构，与更多的词语（如reason和matter）搭配：
data.enText: When it is being used to emphasize facts that other people may not like to hear, plain usually occurs in the expression the plain fact/truth is that… Simple can be used in this way too, but it can also be used in a wider variety of structures and collocations (such as reason and matter ).

data.chText: 问题源于这一简单的事实…
data.enText: The problem was due to the simple fact that…
The problem was due to the plain fact that…
for the plain reason that…
It's a plain matter of…

data.chText: 与simple构成的表达法通常暗指对别人的行为不耐烦。
data.enText: Expressions with simple often suggest impatience with other people's behaviour.
plain or simple?
stark

data.chText: 用于描述令人不快的事实或区别十分明显、鲜明：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) used for describing an unpleasant fact or difference that is very obvious

data.chText: 明摆着的事实是剩下的钱已经不够了。
data.enText: The stark truth is that there is not enough money left.

data.chText: simple/plain truth指所谈的事尽管不中听，但听了可能会有好处。stark truth指所谈之事特别令人不快，而且没有任何好处。
data.enText: The simple/plain truth may be sth that some people do not want to hear, but it may be good for them to hear it anyway. The stark truth is sth particularly unpleasant and has no good side to it at all.
bare

data.chText: 指最基本的、最简单的：
data.enText: [only before noun] the most basic or simple, with nothing extra

data.chText: 她只给我介绍了这个案件的一些基本情况。
data.enText: She gave me only the bare facts of the case.
unequivocal

data.chText: 指表达明确的、毫不含糊的、斩钉截铁的：
data.enText: ( formal ) expressing your opinion or intention very clearly and firmly

data.chText: 回答是个干脆利落的“不”字。
data.enText: The reply was an unequivocal ‘no’.
bald

data.chText: 用于告知别人令人不快的事实时不加赘述、赤裸裸的：
data.enText: used for telling sb a rather unpleasant fact; without any extra explanation or detail to help you accept what is being said

data.chText: 那封信是对我们的法律立场直截了当的声明。
data.enText: The letter was a bald statement of our legal position.

data.chText: bald fact通常比plain/simple fact更令人不快，但不快的程度轻于stark fact。
data.enText: A bald fact is usually more unpleasant than a plain/simple fact , but not as unpleasant as a stark fact .
the plain/simple/stark/bare/unequivocal/bald truth
a(n) plain/simple/stark/bare/unequivocal/bald fact/statement
a(n) plain/simple/unequivocal answer

ex.chText: 她期待能得到一些坦率而真实的回答。
ex.enText: She expected to have some plain and truthful answers.

synonyms.bx: 强调坦诚的、如实表达所思所想的。

ex.chText: 说得不客气一点，很多申请人英语水平都不高。
ex.enText: To be blunt, many of the candidates only have a low level of English.

ex.chText: 她唐突的话语大大地伤害了他。
ex.enText: Her blunt words hurt him so much.

synonyms.bx: 强调直言不讳的，即便可能使别人不悦。

ex.chText: 两位领导人的谈话直率而坦诚。
ex.enText: The conversation between the two leaders was direct and candid.

synonyms.bx: 强调直率的，即使事实令人不舒服或尴尬也要直言相告，不加以隐瞒。

ex.enText: Please give me a direct answer.

ex.chText: 她有时觉得她丈夫太率直了。
ex.enText: She sometimes feels that her husband is too direct.
We have had a frank talk.

ex.chText: 他对你也许不完全坦诚。
ex.enText: He was perhaps not entirely frank with you.

synonyms.bx: 强调有话直说的，不隐瞒自己的观点、意见等。

ex.chText: 原味酸奶曾是她的最爱。
她男朋友给她买了一枚式样简单的金戒指。
ex.enText: Her boyfriend bought her a plain gold ring.

ex.chText: 书架前有一把朴素的木椅子。
ex.enText: There is a plain wooden chair in front of the bookshelf.

synonyms.bx: 指没有添加其他东西的，或没有装饰的。

ex.chText: 这是一个简单而有效的解决办法。
ex.enText: This is a simple but effective solution.

ex.chText: 那位妇人的穿着朴素而优雅。
ex.enText: That lady dressed with simple elegance.

ex.chText: 那家餐馆的饭菜简单却美味，非常受欢迎。
ex.enText: The simple but delicious food in that restaurant is very popular.

synonyms.bx: 指容易做或理解的，也指没有过多装饰或没有添加多余之物的。

ex.chText: 那对夫妇希望他们的卧室朴素无华。
ex.enText: The couple liked their bedroom to be unadorned.

ex.chText: 墙壁是白色的，地面铺了地砖，房间布置得特别朴素。
ex.enText: The room is typically unadorned, with white walls and a tiled floor.

ex.chText: 他仅对那次活动作了不加文饰的记述。
ex.enText: He only made an unadorned account of that activity.

synonyms.bx: 指没有多余或特殊装饰的。

synonym.guide: 导航词义：简单的，朴素的

data.enText: be plain sailing
be clear sailing

data.chText: 顺利；一帆风顺
data.enText: to be simple and free from trouble
in plain English

data.chText: 用平白的言语（或文字）
data.enText: simply and clearly expressed, without using technical language
(as) plain as a pikestaff
(as) plain as day
(as) plain as the nose on your face

data.chText: 一清二楚；一目了然；显而易见
data.enText: very obvious

tr: extensive tract of level open land
example: they emerged from the woods onto a vast open plain
he longed for the fields of his youth

tr: express complaints, discontent, displeasure, or unhappiness
example: She has a lot to kick about
functional architecture featuring stark unornamented concrete

tr: lacking in physical beauty or proportion
example: several of the buildings were downright homely
a plain girl with a freckled face

tr: free from any effort to soften to disguise
example: the unvarnished candor of old people and children

tr: clearly revealed to the mind or the senses or judgment
example: the effects of the drought are apparent to anyone who sees the parched fields
it is plain that he is no reactionary

tr: unmistakably (`plain' is often used informally for `plainly')
example: she was in bed and evidently in great pain
he was manifestly too important to leave off the guest list
she has apparently been living here for some time
I thought he owned the property, but apparently not

value.def: A plain object, surface, or fabric is entirely in one colour and has no pattern, design, or writing on it.

example.ex: In general, a plain carpet makes a room look bigger...
example.tran: 一般来说，单色的地毯使房间显得更宽敞。

example.ex: He placed the paper in a plain envelope...
example.tran: 他把论文装进一个空白信封里。

example.ex: He wore a plain blue shirt, open at the collar.
example.tran: 他穿一件素净的蓝色衬衫，领口敞着。

value.tran: 单色的；素色的；无花纹（或图案、字迹）的

value.def: Something that is plain is very simple in style.

example.ex: Bronwen's dress was plain but it hung well on her...
example.tran: 布朗温的长裙虽然朴素，却很合身。

example.ex: It was a plain, grey stone house, distinguished mainly by its largely unspoilt simplicity.
example.tran: 这是一幢简朴的灰石房子，主要以其天然简约的风格显得与众不同。

example.ex: He was very tall and plainly dressed.

value.def: If a fact, situation, or statement is plain, it is easy to recognize or understand.

example.ex: It was plain to him that I was having a nervous breakdown...
example.tran: 他能明显地看出我快要精神崩溃了。

example.ex: He's made it plain that he loves the game and wants to be involved still.
example.tran: 他明确表示自己热爱这项运动，并仍想参与其中。

gramarinfo.label: usu v-link ADJ, oft <l>it</l> v-link ADJ that

value.def: If you describe someone as plain, you think they look ordinary and not at all beautiful.

example.ex: ...a shy, rather plain girl with a pale complexion.
example.tran: 肤色苍白、相貌平平的害羞女孩

value.def: A plain is a large flat area of land with very few trees on it.

example.ex: Once there were 70 million buffalo on the plains.
example.tran: 北美大平原上曾有过7,000万头野牛。

value.tran: 平原；（几乎没有树木的）大片平地

value.def: You can use plain before an adjective in order to emphasize it.

example.ex: The food was just plain terrible.

posc.def: Plain is also used before a noun.

example.ex: Is it love of publicity or plain stupidity on her part?
example.tran: 她是喜欢抛头露面，还是太过愚蠢了呢？

value.tran: （用于形容词前加强语气）显然，完全地

value.def: You can use plain before a name to emphasize how simple and ordinary it is, especially when you are comparing it with another more unusual or impressive name.

example.ex: Why couldn't they call you plain Ann or Alice like the rest?
example.tran: 他们为什么不能像其他人一样，给你取个普普通通的安或艾丽斯的名字呢？

value.tran: （尤在与另一个更加不同寻常或让人印象深刻的名字比较时表示强调）普通的，平凡的

value.def: If a police officer is in plain clothes, he or she is wearing ordinary clothes instead of a police uniform.

example.ex: Three officers in plain clothes told me to get out of the car.

trans: 纯文本数据，明文(以ASCII形式储存的数据)
简明英语；简易英语；简明化英语；通俗易懂的话；简单英语
中原；中央平原；以及中央平原
轻而易举的;一帆风顺的
平织；平纹织法，平纹梭织，平纹布；平布
平片；照片；X线平片；素片；腹部平片
朴素的语言；浅显易懂的语言
